channel.title: Thread Per Client
channel.description:
What server has had the most amount of players using the thread per client approach? How many could it hold and what were the specs of the box? GOGOGO.
I am curious.

item.title: Thread Per Client
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:19, topic:413775”][quote author=judostar1 link=topic=515746.msg3745241#msg3745241 date=1315687068]

Well, what matters is:
Non-TPC servers:

Hyperion = 2000 players
RuneSource = 2000 players (with 6% CPU usage and all players spamming packets)
rs377d = 2000 players

TPC servers:

Original whitescape: 500 players Delta: 100 players (with stability improvements, without: 50) (most) Other wL servers: 100 players Battlescape: 1000 players

From these bullshitted statistics out of my memory (on the TPC side), I’d say battlescape probably has the record for the most players being held in a tpc server.

iclarity is what side?
[/quote]

It depends on which one you’re talking about… The original Icarlity if I remember correctly was Blakes whitescape with crash patch but thread-per-client wasn’t remove.

The newer one that is based on RuneSource, is non tpc.[/quote]

yea im using thew newer ish one I think.

Read full topic

Well, what matters is:
Non-TPC servers:

Hyperion = 2000 players
RuneSource = 2000 players (with 6% CPU usage and all players spamming packets)
rs377d = 2000 players

TPC servers:

Original whitescape: 500 players Delta: 100 players (with stability improvements, without: 50) (most) Other wL servers: 100 players Battlescape: 1000 players

From these bullshitted statistics out of my memory (on the TPC side), I’d say battlescape probably has the record for the most players being held in a tpc server.
[/quote]

iclarity is what side?[/quote]

It depends on which one you’re talking about… The original Icarlity if I remember correctly was Blakes whitescape with crash patch but thread-per-client wasn’t remove.

The newer one that is based on RuneSource, is non tpc.

Read full topic

item.title: Thread Per Client
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:16, topic:413775”][quote author=judostar1 link=topic=515746.msg3745241#msg3745241 date=1315687068]

Well, what matters is:
Non-TPC servers:

Hyperion = 2000 players
RuneSource = 2000 players (with 6% CPU usage and all players spamming packets)
rs377d = 2000 players

TPC servers:

Original whitescape: 500 players Delta: 100 players (with stability improvements, without: 50) (most) Other wL servers: 100 players Battlescape: 1000 players

From these bullshitted statistics out of my memory (on the TPC side), I’d say battlescape probably has the record for the most players being held in a tpc server.

iClarity originally had TPC, but it’s just like whitescape in the sense that there were tutorials to remove it. iClarity is essentitally equivalent with whitescape, perhaps a bit better (on both sides, tpc and non).
iclarity is what side?
[/quote][/quote]

ty eye.

Read full topic
